column9:
A good variety of shops and restaurants.  From Italian to Pintxos (Baskien), Thai & Burgers (Surf Shack), Sushi, a deli (Holmgrens), bakery (Gateau), White award French Restaurant (Gamla Franska) , Vegetrian restaurant, fish stand and butcher.  

Not very big in size but has much to...More

One of the oldest buildings in the city of Lund. A few years ago it was close to tearing down. The people in town said no. It was renovated and is still as popular as before. May feel a little crowded sometimes. But you survive....More

Saluhallen is a Scandinavian style food market. Its concept is to both sell raw ingredients and to offer a limited but very fresh selection of food (every stand has its own 4/5 dishes). 

The market is quite spacious and has a welcoming atmosphere. Last but...More
this market hall has many shops and restaurants, both Swedish and international. If you go for lunch come early or late, many people are going there

In this magnificent Market Hall you can admire, taste and try the best food and spirits in Lund. I specially recommend the shop dedicates to spirits at a reasonable price. You can grab excellent brands of cavas, Catalan champagne. Enjoy my friends!!!

Go in here and enjoy the different food stores with food and and groceries and sweets from Sweden and other countries in the world.

Especially go to Ahlgreens sweets.

Good quality and really good taste. Healthy sweets. No artificial conservatives.
We had a really nice wrap at the Saluhalle and the girl who sold it was really nice so we enjoyed our food even more.

A small market with more delicious and special ingredients than you would find in the avarage supermarket. Cosy and fun to walk around in. There are a bunch of restaurants inside where you can eat lunch or dinner. It's well worth a visit no matter...More
To stroll around a chose among several restaurants is a pleasure. We chosed a fishrestaurant with positive and nice personel.

column7: Lots of good eating options and reasonable prices
column9: Have been here a few times and tried different shops each time.. you can get fresh fish/poultry to cheese / cured meat and fish to freshly made hot or cold food all under one roof. I have tried most of the shops and no complaints...More

column7: Despite its small size, Lund boasts a covered market.
column9: In the Market Hall you will find some of the city's best specialty stores for food, drinks and delicacies.If you get hungry during the visit, you will find restaurants with different profiles and quality.In great contrast to all the impersonal malls that grows outside the...More
